S. Korean Authorities' Pro-American Flunkeyism Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Pro-American Flunkeyism Assailed 
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea reportedly made public a statement on Jan. 26 to condemn the authorities for their pro-American flunkeyism and treachery.
 The statement recalled that the authorities decided to diminish the screen quota of south Korean films by half, saying "it conforms with the interests of the nation."    
 It warned that if the film market is opened to foreigners, the south Korean moviedom will go bankrupt by the offensive of American films.
 The authorities sold out the food sovereignty and then cultural sovereignty to the U.S. while agreeing on the permission of the "strategic flexibility" of its forces in south Korea, thus leaving all fields of politics, military, economy and culture to the mercy of the U.S., the statement said, urging the authorities to stop their pro-American treachery at once.

Fidel Castro Ruz Congratulates Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Ruz Congratulates Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a congratulatory message from Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, on Jan. 30 on the occasion of his birthday. 
 Fidel in the message noted that he deems it a pleasure to wish Kim Jong Il, who is leading the Korean people in their vigorous struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation, defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve reunification as well as fresh and greater success in his work.
 He reiterated the firm belief that the relations between the two parties, governments and peoples advancing together for a victory of socialism would grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Palestinian Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Palestinian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, February 2 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and had a talk with newly-appointed Palestinian Ambassador to the DPRK Mohammad Shahta Zarab who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
